iana.security_considerations:
vnd.capasystems-pg+json shares security issues common to all JSON content types.
See RFC7159 Section #12 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7159#section-12)
for additional information. vnd.nearst.inv+json does not provide executable
content. 

If privacy is needed it must be realized via the transport layer, e.g. with HTTPs. Additional integrity checking can be built into client and server software that transmits this information, and goes beyond the scope of this document
iana.additional_information:
1. Deprecated alias names for this type: none
2. Magic number(s): none
3. File extension(s): .json
4. Macintosh file type code: TEXT
5. Object Identifiers: none
iana.template_text:
(registered 2017-05-03, last updated 2017-05-03)

Media type name: application

Media subtype name: vnd.capasystems-pg+json

Required parameters: none

Optional parameters: none 

Encoding considerations: binary
Same as [RFC7159]

Security considerations:
vnd.capasystems-pg+json shares security issues common to all JSON content types.
See RFC7159 Section #12 (http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7159#section-12)
for additional information. vnd.nearst.inv+json does not provide executable
content. 

If privacy is needed it must be realized via the transport layer, e.g. with HTTPs. Additional integrity checking can be built into client and server software that transmits this information, and goes beyond the scope of this document

Interoperability considerations:
N/A

Published specification:
The specification is not published yet.

Applications which use this media:
Software interfacing with CapaSystems PerformanceGuard server software, wishing to setup or extract performance measurement data.

Fragment identifier considerations:
N/A

Restrictions on usage:
N/A

Provisional registration? (standards tree only):
N/A

Additional information:

1. Deprecated alias names for this type: none
2. Magic number(s): none
3. File extension(s): .json
4. Macintosh file type code: TEXT
5. Object Identifiers: none

General Comments:
N/A

Person to contact for further information:

1. Name: Yüksel Aydemir
2. Email: yay&capasystems.com

Intended usage: Limited Use
Used primarily by CapaSystems customers that wish to build front ends that display performance data from PerformanceGuard servers

Author/Change controller: Yüksel Aydemir on behalf of CapaSystems A/S
